1.text: Sort through the beans and discard any that are shriveled or discolored, as well as any stems, debris or dirt.

2.text: Place the dried beans in a colander and wash them quickly.

3.text: Use the slow soak method if you've got a night to soak your beans.

4.text: If time is of the essence, try the quick soak.

5.text: Wait for the beans to double or triple in size, depending on what soaking method you decide to use.

6.text: Rinse the beans thoroughly in a colander after soaking.

7.text: Put the beans in a large cooking pot and add enough water to completely cover them.

8.text: Add a tablespoon of vegetable or olive oil to the pot to cut down on excessive foam and boil-over while the beans are cooking.

9.text: Simmer the dried beans on low to medium heat.

10.text: Consult the proper cooking time of the types of beans you're using.

11.text: Test the dried beans by mashing one with a fork or between your fingers.

13.text: Learn how to cook specific varieties of beans.
